intro: Blepharis aspera, commonly known as roughleaf bladdergrass, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, and it is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize disturbed areas. Blepharis aspera is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife.
